channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While conducting loading operations, a pallet that was carrying drums of hazardous waste broke and the drum in question fell. The lid of the drum bent and leaked a small amount (2 gals) of the contents.

item.title: Report X-2024060002
item.description:
Report X-2024060002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The trailer arrived to 004/LIT with a skid of UN1203 on its side. Two of the boxes each containing a can of UN1203 were damaged, causing the product to leak onto the cardboard box and dunnage surrounding the freight. None of the product impacted any surface other than the cardboard and dunnage. The damaged debris and containers were placed into a recovery drum and labeled with the PRO. No remediation was necessary.
